snippet: A United Nations agency estimated that 3.2 million African men had been voluntarily circumcised since 2007. Studies show that the procedure reduces the risk of infection by about 60 percent.
abstract: Research shows that circumcision for AIDS prevention is increasing rapidly in eastern and southern Africa, with 3.2 million African men voluntarily circumcised since 2007; studies show that the procedure reduces the risk of infection by about 60 percent; United Nations has set goal to circumcise 20 million African men by 2015.
lead_paragraph: A United Nations agency estimated that 3.2 million African men had been voluntarily circumcised since 2007. Studies show that the procedure reduces the risk of infection by about 60 percent.

headline.main: Circumcisions to Help Prevent AIDS Are on the Rise
headline.print_headline: Prevention: Circumcisions to Help Prevent AIDS Are on the Rise
